intro: Saurauia aculeata, commonly known as the prickly sarsaparilla, is a member of the Ericaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Saurauia aculeata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
